headline: Disney’s AI Bet And Florida Expansion Reshape Parks And IP Story
summary: Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS) is partnering with OpenAI to use artificial intelligence for content creation featuring its well known franchises. Kristina Schake is set to leave her role as Chief Communications Officer after a period described as transformative for the company. Disney is moving ahead with large scale expansion plans in Florida after reaching a peace agreement with its local oversight district. For investors watching media and entertainment, Disney sits at the intersection of film,...

headline: Sinclair Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Sinclair (NASDAQ:SBGI) executives said the company exited 2025 with results above the midpoint of its guidance, improving trends in core advertising, and a balance sheet they believe is positioned to support a multi-year deleveraging effort. headline: Playboy Appoints David Miller as President, Media & Brand
summary: Media Veteran Miller to Oversee Global Licensing, Digital and Platform Growth Senior Appointment Reflects Playboy’s Accelerating Growth Strategy and Expanding Media and Licensing Operations LOS ANGELES, Feb. 26, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Playboy, Inc. (Nasdaq: PLBY) (“Playboy” or the “Company”), a global pleasure and leisure company, has announced that David Miller has been appointed President, Media & Brand, to drive the next phase of the Company’s growth. headline: Brand Licensing Industry Analysis Report 2026-2035: A $419.03 Billion Market by 2030 with Nike, General Motors, Pokemon, Walt Disney, Procter & Gamble, Warner Media, Paramount Leading
summary: Key market opportunities in the brand licensing sector include the expansion of digital platforms, sustainability-focused partnerships, virtual and metaverse licensing, IP monetization, cross-category brand extensions, and advanced data analytics for royalty management. Asia-Pacific is projected to be the fastest-growing region.
